captions.text: Hi, I'm here in Tokyo
I'm in the technology museum called Miraikan
Located in Odaiba district
This is a world-famous museum
Known, among other things, for its awesome robot exhibition
That's what we're gonna see today
This thing behind me is a cool exhibit, a 6 meter tall model of Earth
Let's see things that are supposed to make us ask questions about the nature of humanity, soul, love etc.
The most popular exhibit is ASIMO, a 2002 robot by Honda
This shows how the future of robotics was seen 15 years ago
ASIMO is all about motion
Today, ASIMO is very popular with the children, who are always happy to see him
One year ago the museum introduced androids
One of them looks to be straight from a Ghost in the Shell movie
For dramatic effect, you have to watch it through this opening
The other android offers conversation
This is done in pairs, one person enters the control room and sees eye camera feeds, has a microphone
The second person obviously talks to the android
Can a human be replaced by a machine?
Can a machine think like a human, or maybe a human brain is a machine?
Behind me is a thing called Uni-Cub
Some of you might recognize it from an OK Go music video
Which was shot somewhere nearby by the way
This is a Honda prototype
Works like a Segway, you control it through your weight balance
You lean forward to go forward and vice versa
(conversational interface) Which one of you guys know when they're gonna release House of Cards?
What are we poor people to do with all this wait
I will now explain to you how to make it big on YouTube
The answer is Let's Play videos
We have to start recording Minecraft
Other games too
Questioning the nature of mankind
This is a robotic seal
It has touch sensors so that it know where you pet it
It's been constructed for therapeutical purposes
If you construct a perfect artificial brain and then put it into a seal, will a seal have a soul?
It already has
The third android is this thing
What up
This project's aim to to test the minimalistic humanoid concept
Tests how far you can go with making it minimalistic and still humanlike
Looking him in the eyes makes me uncomfortable
This museum is a very very cool place to visit
If you plan a trip to Japan, be sure to check out Miraikan museum
It's located in Odaiba, among other pretty cool attractions
If we create a sentient machine, will we be gods according to it?
If you can't tell an android and a human apart, what will the Church's stance on androids be?
What about android gay marriage?

title: Niesamowite androidy i roboty w Japonii [Robots in Miraikan, Tokyo]
